casebody.data:
The Merchants & Traders Bank v. James B. Colgate, Impleaded, &c. Decided January 3, 1888. Exceptions of the defendant Colgate taken at the trial, and ordered to be heard in the first instance at the general term. Wm. Allen Butler, for defendant. Nathaniel Meyers, for plaintiff.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., and Ingraham, J.

Per Curiam.

This case presents the same questions that are presented in the case of the Fifth Avenue National Bank v. Colgate (ante p. 541), and for the same reasons given in that case the exceptions are overruled and judgment ordered for the plaintiff on the verdict with costs.
